Package org.example

Class Pionek

java.lang.Object
org.example.Pionek
public class Pionek extends Object
It contains both pawns and their logic

  • Constructor Details

    • Pionek

      public Pionek(boolean isWhite, int x, int y, int sizeOfPlansza, boolean isPolish)
      Pawn's constructor, it's setting flags of pawns and adding each one to list of pawns on which logic will be operated
      Parameters:
      isWhite - table of colors of pawns
      x - table of xs of pawns
      y - table of ys of pawns
      sizeOfPlansza - size of plansza
      isPolish - are these polish checkers or not

  • Method Details

    • isWhite

      public boolean isWhite()
      getter of pawns colour
      Returns:
      true if pawn is white, fals elsewhere.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      getter of pawns activeness
      Returns:
      true if pawn is active, fals elsewhere.

    • setActive

      public void setActive(boolean active)
      setter of pawns activeness. If it sets pawn to be active, it disactivates every other pawn.
      Parameters:
      active -

    • move

      public void move(int x, int y)
      sets coordinates of pawn. Also deletes enemy if enemy was captured during move and sets pawn to become a queen
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate of targeting field
      y - coordinate of targeting field

    • getPionki

      public static List<Pionek> getPionki()
      getter of static pawns list
      Returns:
      list of existing pawns in game

    • isQueen

      public boolean isQueen()
      getter of whether the pawn is queen
      Returns:
      true if pawn is queen, false elsewhere

      setter of queen status
      Parameters:

    • bicia

      public static ArrayList<Integer> bicia(int x, int y, boolean isWhite, boolean isQueen)
      searches for legal captures of pawn of specific type
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of pawn
      y - y coordinate of pawn
      isWhite - if pawn is white
      isQueen - if pawn is queen
      Returns:
      array of coordinates of fields pawn can go to make a capture
